page.title: 06CUSTOMS
page.content: Every year the boys from Hurstpierpoint College climb Wolstonbury Hill on{Ascension Day. } Wolstonbury Hill was the site of an ancient Iron Age fort. The origin of this custom is in the choir singing from the highest hill. In Hurstpierpoint,{May Day}is traditionally celebrated with men and women{Morris Dancing}on the Green or outside the local public houses. In 1313 one Lawrence de Pierpoint, a person of some repute instituted a local fair with a charter from the King, the{St.Lawrence Fair.}This tradition still flourishes today. Burgess Hill has a flourishing { {Bonfire Society}whose activities come to a grand finale with a spectacular procession through the streets of the town in November. They also join the Lewes Celebrations on{November 5th.
